content.rendered:
CIAHN Atacama

We are

Hello, we invite you to...

The Research and Advancement Corporation for Atacama’s Paleontology and Natural History (CIAHN Atacama) is a regional non-profit private corporation pursuing the expansion of the scientific research and the valuation of the paleontological patrimony of the region, supporting the growth and positively impacting Atacama’s comprehensive development.

  • Send message
SKELETONS FOUND IN CERRO BALLENA
0

ATACAMA, LAND OF FOSSILS

The region of Atacama is recognized by its paleontological wealth: there are areas where people can walk on thousands of fossil bones, which is the case of the Bahía Inglesa Formation.

TOTAL EXPLORED SURFACE
12%
POTENTIALLY FOSSILIFEROUS ZONES IN THE COMMUNE OF CALDERA
23.5%

Paleo Atacama

  • 01

    Atacama as a Natural Laboratory

    We think Atacama as a natural lab, as an exceptional space to witness global processes of the history of our planet Earth and the evolution of life.

    Read More

  • 02

    Atacama’s Paleontological Potential

    One of the distinctive features of the region of Atacama is its paleontological patrimony. The dryness has exposed kilometers of rocks ...

    Read More

  • 03

    The Wonderful Deposit of Caldera

    In the coast of the region of Atacama there is one of the most important paleontological deposits of Chile and South America

    Read More

Atacama’s Junior Academy of Sciences

"This is a site on par with Dinosaur National Monument here in the United States, a whole hillside littered with dinosaur skeletons. We seem to have the same thing except with whales here in Chile."

Nick Pyenson, Smithsonian's National Museum of Natural History (EEUU), about the findings in Cerro Ballena (Whale Hill).
